timeline.body: If you want to test `INTEGER ARRAY`, you need to add some support for it first. Currently all arrays are incorrectly mapped to `PG_TYPE_TEXTARRAY`, but they should be mapped to different types of PostgreSQL, this type is suitable only for `VARCHAR ARRAY`.

replies.bodyText:
Prepare statement for an Array does not work like
PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement("INSERT INTO test (id, x1) VALUES (1, ?)")
Array arr = conn.createArrayOf("VARCHAR", new Object[] {"'a'b'c'", "d\"e", "{,}"});

pg-jdbc seems to generate an SQL that H2 does not support:
SELECT t.oid, t.typname   FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t  JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON t.typnamespace = n.oid WHERE t.typelem = (SELECT oid FROM pg_catalog.pg_type WHERE typname = $1) AND substring(t.typname, 1, 1) = '_' AND t.typlen = -1 AND (n.nspname = $2 OR $3 AND n.nspname = ANY (current_schemas(true))) ORDER BY t.typelem DESC LIMIT 1
replies.author: auntyellow

replies.bodyText: Does it work with setObject(column, Object[] or String[])?
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText:
setObject(column, String[], Types.ARRAY) works, and send:
INSERT INTO test (id, x1) VALUES (1, $1)
$1 = {"'a'b'c'", "d\"e", "{,}"}

But H2 gets an array with one element {"{\"'a'b'c'\", \"d\\\"e\", \"{,}\"}"}.
And PostgreSQL 12 works correct.
replies.author: auntyellow

replies.bodyText: Hypothetically PgServerThread.setParameter() can parse PG_TYPE_TEXTARRAY parameters in that way.
replies.author: katzyn
